newsitem.title: USA: RAINFALL MAY AFFECT S.AFRICA CORN -- U.S. ATTACHE.
newsitem.headline: RAINFALL MAY AFFECT S.AFRICA CORN -- U.S. ATTACHE.

text.p: An agricultural attache posted at the U.S. embassy in Pretoria said that heavy rainfall has caused damage to young corn in South Africa and may have a bad impact on the quality of the crop.

"Based on post field observations and other reports, the recent rainfall has caused damage to crops that are still on the land, particularly corn and groundnuts, and, may impact on the quality thereof," the attache wrote in a report dated June 2 that was released in Washington on Thursday.
The attache said at the same time, the late rain resulted in soil moisture ideal for wheat production, indicating the possibility of a good crop.
Attache reports are not official USDA data.
